text: opened in Nobeoka, Miyazaki Prefecture, Japan, in 1963. The collection relates to the history, culture, and folklore of Nobeoka with a particular emphasis on the Naitō clan; as of March 2015, it comprised some 53,000 archaeological materials, 11,780 historical materials, 3,200 folk materials, and 760 artworks (primarily prints and yōga). Currently being redeveloped at a projected cost of ¥2.8 bn, the museum is scheduled to reopen in 2022. ==See also== * History of Miyazaki Prefecture * List of Historic Sites of Japan (Miyazaki) * List of Cultural Properties of Japan - paintings (Miyazaki) ==References== Category:Museums in Miyazaki Prefecture Category:Museums established in 1963 Category:1963 establishments in Japan Category:Nobeoka, Miyazaki
title: Naitō Memorial Museum
